A womanâ€™s body produces wet mucus during her fertile time to help sperm get into the womb. With the Mucus method, you check the mucus (wetness) in your vagina to know when you are becoming fertile and you don't have sexual intercourse during those days.

  • How to use

    How to tell when you are fertile:

    1. Wipe the outside of your vagina with your finger, a piece of paper, or cloth.
    2. If there is mucus there, take some between your fingers. Does it feel wet and slippery? Dry and sticky?
    clear, wet, slippery mucus = fertile
    white, dry, sticky mucus = not fertile
  • To prevent pregnancy
    • Don't have sex on any day you see or feel wetness or mucus. Or, if you do have sex on those days, use a condom or a diaphragm without spermicide (these are the only methods that don't change the mucus).
    • Don't have sex until 2 days after the last day of clear, slippery mucus.
    • Don't have sex during menstruation. There is a small possibility you could be fertile and not be able to tell.
    • Don't douche or wash out your vagina at any time. This will wash the mucus away.

    If you are having trouble knowing when you are fertile, or you have a vaginal infection, you should change to a different method.
